intro: Atraphaxis laetevirens, commonly known as the golden burr, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that enclose seeds, a feature typical of many members of its family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its yellowish-green foliage and distinctive seed heads make it easily identifiable in its natural habitat.
